SEARCH
Package io.brane.rpc

Class Brane.Builder

java.lang.Object
io.brane.rpc.Brane.Builder
Enclosing interface:
Brane
public static final class Brane.Builder extends Object
Builder for creating Brane client instances.

The builder provides fine-grained control over client configuration, including transport selection, retry behavior, and chain-specific settings.

Configuration Options

Builder Configuration Options
MethodDescriptionRequired
rpcUrl(String)HTTP/HTTPS RPC endpoint URLYes (unless provider set)
wsUrl(String)WebSocket endpoint for subscriptionsNo
provider(BraneProvider)Custom provider instanceAlternative to rpcUrl
invalid reference 
#signer(Signer)
Transaction signerYes for Signer client
chain(ChainProfile)Chain-specific configurationNo
retries(int)Max retry attemptsNo (default: 3)
retryConfig(RpcRetryConfig)Retry backoff settingsNo

Terminal Methods

  • build() - Returns Brane.Signer if signer configured, otherwise Brane.Reader
  • buildReader() - Explicitly builds a read-only Brane.Reader
  • buildSigner() - Explicitly builds a signing Brane.Signer (requires signer)

Usage Examples

Simple HTTP client: 


 Brane client = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/YOUR_KEY")
     .build();

With chain profile and retries: 


 Brane client = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/YOUR_KEY")
     .chain(ChainProfiles.MAINNET)
     .retries(5)
     .build();

With transaction signing: 


 Signer key = PrivateKey.fromHex("0x...");
 Brane.Signer client = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/YOUR_KEY")
     .signer(key)
     .chain(ChainProfiles.MAINNET)
     .buildSigner();

With custom provider: 


 BraneProvider customProvider = new MyCustomProvider();
 Brane client = Brane.builder()
     .provider(customProvider)
     .build();

With custom retry configuration: 


 RpcRetryConfig retryConfig = RpcRetryConfig.builder()
     .baseDelayMs(100)
     .maxDelayMs(5000)
     .jitterFactor(0.1)
     .build();

 Brane client = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth.example.com")
     .retries(10)
     .retryConfig(retryConfig)
     .build();
Since:
0.1.0

  • Method Details

    • rpcUrl

      public Brane.Builder rpcUrl(String rpcUrl)
      Sets the HTTP/HTTPS RPC endpoint URL.

      This is mutually exclusive with provider(BraneProvider). If both are set, the explicit provider takes precedence.

      Parameters:
      rpcUrl - the RPC endpoint URL (e.g., "https://eth.example.com")
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • wsUrl

      public Brane.Builder wsUrl(String wsUrl)
      Sets the WebSocket endpoint URL for the client.

      When set, the client uses a WebSocket transport instead of HTTP. This enables real-time subscription methods like Brane.onNewHeads(java.util.function.Consumer<io.brane.core.model.BlockHeader>) and Brane.onLogs(io.brane.rpc.LogFilter, java.util.function.Consumer<io.brane.core.model.LogEntry>).

      Provider resolution priority: explicit provider(BraneProvider) > wsUrl > rpcUrl(String).

      Example - WebSocket client: 

      
 // Create a WebSocket-based client with subscription support
 Brane client = Brane.builder()
     .wsUrl("wss://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/YOUR_KEY")
     .build();

 // Subscribe to new blocks (only works with WebSocket)
 client.onNewHeads(header -> {
     System.out.println("New block: " + header.number());
 });

      Example - WebSocket client with signing: 

      
 Brane.Signer client = Brane.builder()
     .wsUrl("wss://eth-mainnet.g.alchemy.com/v2/YOUR_KEY")
     .signer(PrivateKey.fromHex("0x..."))
     .build();
      Parameters:
      wsUrl - the WebSocket endpoint URL (e.g., "wss://eth.example.com/ws")
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • provider

      public Brane.Builder provider(BraneProvider provider)
      Sets a custom provider for RPC communication.

      This is mutually exclusive with rpcUrl(String). If both are set, the explicit provider takes precedence.

      Parameters:
      provider - the custom provider instance
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • signer

      public Brane.Builder signer(Signer signer)
      Sets the signer for transaction signing.

      If a signer is provided, build() will return a Brane.Signer instance capable of sending transactions. Without a signer, build() returns a Brane.Reader instance limited to read-only operations.

      Parameters:
      signer - the signer instance for transaction signing
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • chain

      public Brane.Builder chain(ChainProfile chain)
      Sets the chain profile for network-specific configuration.

      The chain profile provides network-specific settings such as whether EIP-1559 transactions are supported. If not set, the client will operate without network-specific optimizations.

      Parameters:
      chain - the chain profile
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Since:
      0.1.0
      See Also:
      • ChainProfiles

    • retries

      public Brane.Builder retries(int retries)
      Sets the maximum number of retry attempts for transient RPC failures.

      When an RPC call fails with a transient error (e.g., network timeout, rate limiting), the client will retry up to this many times before throwing an exception.

      Default is 3 retries.

      Parameters:
      retries - the maximum number of retries (must be >= 0)
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if retries is negative
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • retryConfig

      public Brane.Builder retryConfig(RpcRetryConfig retryConfig)
      Sets the retry configuration for backoff timing.

      This configuration controls the exponential backoff behavior when retrying failed RPC calls, including base delay, maximum delay, and jitter parameters.

      If not set, RpcRetryConfig.defaults() is used.

      Parameters:
      retryConfig - the retry configuration
      Returns:
      this builder for chaining
      Since:
      0.1.0
      See Also:
      • RpcRetryConfig

    • build

      public Brane build()
      Builds a Brane client based on the configured options.

      This method returns:

      • A Brane.Signer if a signer was configured via
        invalid reference 
        #signer(Signer)
      • A Brane.Reader if no signer was configured

      Example: 

      
 // Returns Reader (no signer)
 Brane reader = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth.example.com")
     .build();

 // Returns Signer (with signer)
 Brane signer = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth.example.com")
     .signer(mySigner)
     .build();
      Returns:
      a new Brane client instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if neither rpcUrl nor provider is configured
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • buildReader

      public Brane.Reader buildReader()
      Builds a read-only Brane.Reader client.

      Use this method when you only need read operations and want to ensure the returned type is Brane.Reader at compile time.

      Example: 

      
 Brane.Reader reader = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth.example.com")
     .chain(ChainProfiles.MAINNET)
     .buildReader();
      Returns:
      a new read-only Brane.Reader instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if neither rpcUrl nor provider is configured
      Since:
      0.1.0

    • buildSigner

      public Brane.Signer buildSigner()
      Builds a signing-capable Brane.Signer client.

      Use this method when you need transaction signing capability and want to ensure the returned type is Brane.Signer at compile time.

      Example: 

      
 Brane.Signer signer = Brane.builder()
     .rpcUrl("https://eth.example.com")
     .signer(PrivateKey.fromHex("0x..."))
     .chain(ChainProfiles.MAINNET)
     .buildSigner();
      Returns:
      a new signing-capable Brane.Signer instance
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if neither rpcUrl nor provider is configured
      IllegalStateException - if no signer is configured
      Since:
      0.1.0
